javadoc:
Service provided by a plugin that shows the listing from a Program, i.e., a
 Code Viewer. The service allows other plugins to add components and 
 actions local to the Code Viewer.

methods.javadoc:
Add a provider that shows an overview of the program.
@param overviewProvider provider to add
methods.name: addOverviewProvider
methods.comment: Add a provider that shows an overview of the program.

methods.javadoc:
Remove a provider that shows an overview of the program.
@param overviewProvider provider to remove
methods.name: removeOverviewProvider
methods.comment: Remove a provider that shows an overview of the program.

methods.name: addMarginProvider
methods.comment:
Add a provider that shows markers in a program for the portion 
 that is visible.

methods.name: removeMarginProvider
methods.comment:
Remove a provider that shows markers in a program for the portion 
 that is visible.

methods.javadoc:
Add an action that is local to the Code Viewer.
@param action local action to add
methods.name: addLocalAction
methods.comment: Add an action that is local to the Code Viewer.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the local action from the Code Viewer.
@param action local action to remove
methods.name: removeLocalAction
methods.comment: Remove the local action from the Code Viewer.

methods.javadoc:
Add a provider that will be notified for drag and drop actions.
@param provider for drag and drop
methods.name: addProgramDropProvider
methods.comment: Add a provider that will be notified for drag and drop actions.

methods.javadoc:
Add a listener that is notified when a mouse button is pressed.
@param listener
methods.name: addButtonPressedListener
methods.comment: Add a listener that is notified when a mouse button is pressed.

methods.javadoc:
Remove the button pressed listener.
@param listener
methods.name: removeButtonPressedListener
methods.comment: Remove the button pressed listener.

methods.name: setHighlightProvider
methods.comment:
Set the highlight  provider. The existing provider is replaced
 with the given provider.

params.name: program
params.comment: The program with which to associate the given provider.

methods.name: removeHighlightProvider
methods.comment: Remove the highlight provider.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program associated with the given provider.

methods.name: setListingPanel
methods.comment: Set a listing panel on the code viewer.

methods.javadoc:
Set the {@link CoordinatedListingPanelListener} for this listing.
@param listener the listener to add.
methods.name: setCoordinatedListingPanelListener
methods.comment: Set the CoordinatedListingPanelListener for this listing.

methods.javadoc: Remove the given listing panel from the code viewer.
methods.name: removeListingPanel
methods.comment: Remove the given listing panel from the code viewer.

methods.javadoc: Get Current view that the CodeViewer is showing.
methods.name: getView
methods.comment: Get Current view that the CodeViewer is showing.

methods.name: goTo
methods.comment: Commands the code viewer to position the cursor at the given location.

params.name: loc
params.comment: the location at which to position the cursor.

params.name: centerOnScreen
params.comment:
if true, the location will be placed in the center of the display
 window

methods.javadoc: Return the fieldPanel.
methods.name: getFieldPanel
methods.comment: Return the fieldPanel.

methods.javadoc: Returns the current address-index-map
methods.name: getAddressIndexMap
methods.comment: Returns the current address-index-map

methods.javadoc:
Place a component in the North area of the CodeViewer.
@param comp component to place in the North area of the CodeViewer
methods.name: setNorthComponent
methods.comment: Place a component in the North area of the CodeViewer.

params.name: comp
params.comment: component to place in the North area of the CodeViewer

methods.javadoc:
Returns the Layout of Fields for the given Address.
@param addr the address at which to get a Layout
methods.name: getLayout
methods.comment: Returns the Layout of Fields for the given Address.

params.name: addr
params.comment: the address at which to get a Layout

methods.javadoc: tells the browser to rebuild the display.
methods.name: updateDisplay
methods.comment: tells the browser to rebuild the display.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the current ListingLayoutModel;
@return the current ListingLayoutModel;
methods.name: getListingModel
methods.comment: Gets the current ListingLayoutModel;

methods.javadoc:
Gets the navigatable for the code viewer service.
@return the navigatable for the code viewer service.
methods.name: getNavigatable
methods.comment: Gets the navigatable for the code viewer service.

return.comment: the navigatable for the code viewer service.

methods.javadoc:
Get the main Listing panel for the code viewer service.
@return the listing panel.
methods.name: getListingPanel
methods.comment: Get the main Listing panel for the code viewer service.

methods.name: getCurrentFieldTextSelection
methods.comment:
Returns a String representing the current character-based selection of the currently 
 selected field.  If there is no selection, or if there is a ProgramSelection 
 (which spans multiple fields), then this method will return null.   
 
 To know which field contains the selection,

return.comment: the currently selected text within a given field

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current field under the cursor.
@return the current field under the cursor.
methods.name: getCurrentField
methods.comment: Returns the current field under the cursor.

return.comment: the current field under the cursor.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current cursor location.
@return the current cursor location.
methods.name: getCurrentLocation
methods.comment: Returns the current cursor location.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the current program selection (which crosses multiple fields).
@return the current program selection.
methods.name: getCurrentSelection
methods.comment: Returns the current program selection (which crosses multiple fields).

name: CodeViewerService
comment:
Service provided by a plugin that shows the listing from a Program, i.e., a
 Code Viewer. The service allows other plugins to add components and 
 actions local to the Code Viewer.
